With the opening of the Biennales De Buenos Aires (BRA) and Buenos Aires Público (BRA), the Buenos Aires–based nonprofit Arts and artists from the Philippines are collaborating in the city of Buenos Aires to create new works.The initiative was sparked by the global health crisis caused by the novel coronavirus, which has infected more than 239,000 people in the Philippines, and aims to draw attention to issues that have not been addressed by government and local institutions. The BRA was organized as part of the city’s commitment to openness and collaboration with the city’s arts community. The initiative is part of a nationwide campaign launched by the city and government to encourage more Filipinos to engage with their cities, culture, and the arts.
